title: Yorubek
author: Yorubek
content: Hello everybody, how are you? In this forum i am new and proud to be here as a member of this forum. Heard there is a lot of discussion about Bitcoin so I came to join here for my own needs. Hope you all will help me. I don't have a good idea about cryptocurrencies. I just know that investing in Bitcoin is extremely profitable. But I don't know how to do it. One of my acquaintance suggested me to invest some money in Bitcoin. I told him how many dollars to invest and he said as much as I am willing to invest. I made up my mind that I would invest $500 but i am confused. I don't know much about Bitcoin so the person gave me the link to this website and suggest me to know about the various opinions of users on various topics. Since I see that Bitcoin is always discussed , I want your suggestions about my Bitcoin investment.Should I invest money with the suggestion of that guy? He told me that if I invest I will get good profit. He said, he will open my bitcoin wallet and help to buy bitcoins. Should I invest in bitcoin?

comments.author: Egii Nna
comments.body: You are welcome to the forum, and I am happy to say to you that you have come to the right place, because here is where you will have all the information that you need about bitcoin and even other alt coins.My suggestion for what I will say to you is that you should understand bitcoin first before you invest in it, because it is of no use to invest your money in something you know nothing about, so you should know and understand how bitcoin works. If you have done that, no one will tell you the amount to invest. You will know the amount to invest when you understand how bitcoin works.Actually, investing in bitcoin is profitable, but understand it first before you invest because if you depend on the suggestions of others, you will end up blaming them. You shouldn’t be brainwashed by the profit; invest the amount that you know you can lose. In this case, I will like to tell you that you are the one to determine what to invest. Quote from: Yorubek on December 28, 2023, 05:42:32 AM He said, he will open my bitcoin wallet and help to buy bitcoins. Should I invest in bitcoin?Yes, it is a good idea to invest in bitcoin, but understand it before you invest in it.especially, be cautious about him that will open the wallet for you, and make sure you keep your seed phase (private key) very secure and not allow anyone to have access to your private key (seed phase), because if someone has access to those keys, it is like he has access to your bitcoin, and I hope you know what that means.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: Quote from: Yorubek on December 28, 2023, 05:42:32 AMShould I invest money with the suggestion of that guy? He's not wrong for telling you about investing with any amount you're willing to invest. That also means that amount is what you are willing to lose. Why so? It's because this market is highly volatile. I don't want to encourage you to invest but right now, you are not yet ready IMO. What you must do is read more info or gain more knowledge so you understand what you are investing with.Quote from: Yorubek on December 28, 2023, 05:42:32 AMHe told me that if I invest I will get good profit. He said, he will open my bitcoin wallet and help to buy bitcoins. Should I invest in bitcoin?He's right that you'll get good profits in time but I disagree about it that he's the one that will create you your Bitcoin wallet. He can guide you but the wallet that you must use is a wallet that provides you your private keys. You can invest in Bitcoin but do that later when you understand these things already. Also read some guides about the forum which I've included below.[General] Bitcoin Wallets - Which, what, why?Newbies - Read before posting

comments.author: MFahad
comments.body: Quote from: Yorubek on December 28, 2023, 05:42:32 AMHello everybody, how are you? In this forum i am new and proud to be here as a member of this forum. Heard there is a lot of discussion about Bitcoin so I came to join here for my own needs. Hope you all will help me. I don't have a good idea about cryptocurrencies. I just know that investing in Bitcoin is extremely profitable. But I don't know how to do it. One of my acquaintance suggested me to invest some money in Bitcoin. I told him how many dollars to invest and he said as much as I am willing to invest. I made up my mind that I would invest $500 but i am confused. I don't know much about Bitcoin so the person gave me the link to this website and suggest me to know about the various opinions of users on various topics. Since I see that Bitcoin is always discussed , I want your suggestions about my Bitcoin investment.Should I invest money with the suggestion of that guy? He told me that if I invest I will get good profit. He said, he will open my bitcoin wallet and help to buy bitcoins. Should I invest in bitcoin?First of all welcome to this forum which will surely be very useful for you. You have heard right about bitcoin, indeed bitcoin is a good investment, and people who have capital prefer to invest in bitcoin. Whoever advised you to invest in Bitcoin must have given you good advice. You have no idea about investing in bitcoin, because you don't know anything about cryptocurrency. so in my opinion you need to know about cryptocurrency market first.You can find complete information about Bitcoin from various platforms and useful information about investing in the cryptocurrency market is everywhere. However, I would suggest that you don't rely on anyone else to buy bitcoins and create a wallet, but rather learn about creating a wallet yourself, and when and how to buy bitcoins. It's still a good time to invest in Bitcoin, and if you invest $500, that's a small amount considering the price of Bitcoin, but still a good start for a new investor.

comments.author: Marvelman
comments.body: Quote from: Yorubek on December 28, 2023, 05:42:32 AMShould I invest money with the suggestion of that guy? He told me that if I invest I will get good profit. He said, he will open my bitcoin wallet and help to buy bitcoins. Should I invest in bitcoin?Before you throw your money into Bitcoin or Ethereum or whatever, you gotta educate yourself so you actually understand what you're getting into.  As for that guy's suggestions, maybe he actually knows his stuff when it comes to crypto.  You should probably ask him some harder questions before taking his advice and  like, what's his background with all this? Does he really understand it or is he just seeing dollar signs? Gotta make sure hes not leading you down a rabbit hole.  But if he has real expertise hey, maybe you should listen.  Either way, you should look into it more yourself too.  Do your own research before throwing money around.  In the end though, it comes down to trusting his motivations.  If something feels off there better to trust your gut.

comments.author: Manny@11111
comments.body: What is worth doing is worth doing well. You need to understand any business or investment you want to engaged in, with this you will be able to make right judgement on amount to commit. Don't get it wrong, Bitcoin is a profit investment worth investing in but you need to full understand everything about it and other cryptos.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Firstly, you must understand that by entrusting the creation of a wallet to another person, you are entrusting him with ownership of your wallet. Since you are a beginner, you probably don’t know that the seed phrase that is created when creating a wallet is important, and it is this that needs to be kept away from other eyes. But by helping, your friend can keep it for themselves.Therefore, investing in Bitcoin is of course always good, but do not be hasty; take the time to learn some points about creating a wallet and buying Bitcoin yourself. And also read not only bright success stories from investing in Bitcoin but also stories of people losing them. And how can you protect yourself from this.

comments.author: Nrcewker
comments.body: Welcome to the forum mate. Investing in Bitcoins doesn’t guarantee you profits mate, you need to make your fundamentals regarding the coin very strong. You need to understand that Bitcoins have grown in price across the years, so if you buy now then there is chance that it might grow more in the future. Hence you should definitely invest in it for long time. Moreover, I would suggest to read articles online or watch YouTube videos on how to use a Bitcoin wallet and manage the Bitcoins. Trusting 2nd person here can be very harmful.

comments.author: retreat
comments.body: Before investing in Bitcoin, it's a good idea for you to know the basic things about Bitcoin and what the risks are of investing in it. Because even though investing in Bitcoin has the potential for high profits, it carries the risk that your investment value could decrease if the market is bearish. You have to understand things like this, there should be lots of sources on Google that you can read about Bitcoin and its risks.And just as a piece of advice, you have to open your own wallet and don't let other people use it, even your own relatives. The wallet is where you store your Bitcoins and if someone wants to do evil they can back up your private key and import it on their device, and then they can send Bitcoins from that wallet. Be careful with your wallet and assets.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: As you are new to this forum that's why I highly welcome you to this amazing forum where you'll get a lot of information about Bitcoin and crypto-currencies in general. The person who told you about investing in Bitcoin did a great job because it's the best asset in the market as of this time and anyone who learns about Bitcoin and investing in Bitcoin will get profits if he/she aims to hold that investment for long term.Although, an investor can get profits by investing in Bitcoin but it's not possible to get a lot of profits by investing in Bitcoin right now. Bitcoin is already over $43k a Bitcoin and it's expected that in this bull run Bitcoin may reach to $120k a Bitcoin. This bull run will continue for at least 2 years at minimum as speculated by professional market analysts and if you invest in Bitcoin right now then you may get more than 100% profit if its price reaches $86k or more.But before investing in Bitcoin I would suggest you to learn about Bitcoin by reading as many topics on this forum as possible and you should also try to learn about personal wallets like Electrum in detail and use it yourself for sometime with small amounts. Once you learn it properly then you should create your own personal wallet and keep the seed phrase in a secret place that you get when using the Electrum wallet. Never share your seed phrase with anyone because if someone learns about your seed phrase then they can easily transfer your Bitcoin from a remote computer.I would say that the tough part is to learn about personal wallets and that's only a little bit tough for the newbie users but once you learn about it and you also learn that how you can protect your seed phrase and private keys then you won't face any problems with Bitcoin investment. I would also suggest you to go with a DCA strategy when you have learnt about the personal wallet and its security. With a DCA strategy you may invest $100 to $1000 per week into Bitcoin. I won't suggest you to go with $10 to $20 based DCA investing as that's not going to be helpful you should begin DCA with at least $50 a week and continue investing in that way.

comments.author: bluebit25
comments.body: Welcome to this forum. First of all, as a newbie, I think you should learn about Bitcoin/crypto, there is a lot of basic knowledge about it that you can search for yourself. And here I see you coming to invest to bring big profits through bitcoin  , first of all I don't want to obscure your thoughts, but you also need to understand more about investing with risks/returns and The problem mainly comes from individuals. Through bitcoin/crypto it is a tool for you to find what you are looking for. But it will be similar to many things in life about investing in knowledge, health, time, money, relationships,... if you do not grasp the basics and just participate. The way it is presented, it is indeed a danger. I can mention the story of using a car, we all know it has benefits such as reducing travel time, protecting us from the weather,... but if we don't learn how to drive, we just sit above it, sooner or later you will have to pay the price. So still welcome to this environment, freely express your opinions and always learn from everyone, I hope you will have a great experience in this field.

comments.author: Ruttoshi
comments.body: Your friend is a very nice person to introduce you to this forum so that you can learn by yourself without anyone to help you do anything. Whatever you want to know about bitcoin investment, you will get the information on this forum. You need to know the basics of bitcoin first, which is which wallet to use and how to buy and send bitcoin from wallets to exchange and vice-versa.You can create a self custody wallet yourself by downloading it from the official site. Electrum wallet and blue wallet are good mobile wallets and if you want a hard wallet, you can use Electrum cold storage wallet. As a newbie, you can use a mobile wallets for a start and as you continue learning and increasing your bitcoin, you can choose the right wallet that suits you. The best way for you to invest in bitcoin in a long term investment so that you can limit the risk investing in bitcoin. Use DCA method to buy bitcoin weekly or monthly since you just started your bitcoin journey.You can be investing and learning at the same time since you are into a long term investment journey. Don't keep your bitcoin in an exchange because, they are in control of your funds, keep your seed phrase safe from third party and back up your seed phrase by writing it on a paper and keep the three copies, in different location very far from each other.

comments.author: BABY SHOES
comments.body: I'm sure other people will help you a lot to know about the basics of Bitcoin before you start investing, so study what they share here and read so you understand it.Because you are still a beginner and unfamiliar with Bitcoin, you need to know this from the basics.Yes investing in bitcoin is profitable but you need to know that it is not for the short term but long term so you can benefit from investing in bitcoin, in fact it is not easy to start especially as a layman you still don't know what it feels like during a bearish market when there is a lot of panic, you follow fomo because you sell bitcoin in the middle of the road because the price is afraid of going down, so you also need to learn this, including patience in investing in bitcoin.$500 is enough to start, but you also have to be able to continue accumulating if possible, don't just rely on $500 and then let it sit, so when you have more money, it's better to invest in bitcoin using the DCA method every week or month depending on your cash flow. .I also started small but until now I will continue to accumulate.
